DataListSpec.Name: Prospect Conversion Results Data List
DataListSpec.Description: List of the successful prospect conversions from business process.
DataListSpec.Author: Memphis Sellers

SPDataList.common:CreateProcedureSQL:
create procedure dbo.USR_USP_DATALIST_PROSPECTCONVERSION_BUSINESSPROCESS_SUCCESSFULRESULTS(@CONTEXTID uniqueidentifier) as set nocount on;
--declare @contextID uniqueidentifier = 'dbbf5927-df46-4ba3-8241-9a50400519c9';
declare @tablePrefix nvarchar(255) = 'dbo.USR_PROSPECTSPONSOR_CONVERSION_BUSINESSPROCESS_' -- This is the name of part of the success table name created by the business process (without the guid) declare @tableGUIDString nvarchar(50) = replace (convert (nvarchar(50),@contextID), '-', '_') -- Convert the guid to have underscores instead of dashes
declare @selectSuccessSQL as nvarchar(max) set @selectSuccessSQL = 'select SPONSORLOOKUPID,NUMBERSPONSORSHIPCONVERSIONS,CONVERSIONDATE,CONVERSIONRESULT,EXCEPTIONMESSAGE' + ' from ' + @tablePrefix + @tableGUIDString
create table #prospectConversionProcessResults(SPONSORLOOKUPID nvarchar(10), NUMBERSPONSORSHIPCONVERSIONS int, CONVERSIONDATE date, CONVERSIONRESULT nvarchar(7), EXCEPTIONMESSAGE nvarchar(max)) insert into #prospectConversionProcessResults exec (@selectSuccessSQL)
select SPONSORLOOKUPID ,NUMBERSPONSORSHIPCONVERSIONS ,CONVERSIONDATE ,CONVERSIONRESULT ,EXCEPTIONMESSAGE
from #prospectConversionProcessResults cq order by CONVERSIONDATE desc
